intro: Blepharocalyx tweediei f. amarus, commonly known as the rarest form of the silverleaf mahogany, is a rare and critically endangered plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant is notable for its limited distribution, occurring only in a few restricted habitats in the northern parts of the island of Luzon. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it faces significant threats from deforestation and habitat loss. Conservation efforts are crucial to ensure its survival in the wild.
